Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

git flow

## git flow 


![image](http://static.cosmeapp.com/FqoiVHHk3A5XeVNnJrj3VuMybjSW?imageView2/2/w/611/h/815)

>[nvie](http://nvie.com/posts/a-successful-git-branching-model/)


## 

    brew install git-flow

## git flow 

git flow :

    usage: git flow <subcommand>

    Available subcommands are:
       init      Initialize a new git repo with support for the branching model.
       feature   Manage your feature branches.
       release   Manage your release branches.
       hotfix    Manage your hotfix branches.
       support   Manage your support branches.
       version   Shows version information.


Samples:

    1.  git feature start meibox meibox.
    2.  git feature publish meibox meibox
    3.  git feature finish meibox meiboxdev

    
    git push origin --delete feature-test

## 

    master    ~  ()
    dev       ~ 
    feature-  ~ 
    hotfix-   ~

Post.title: git
Post._content:
Limitsy[](https://huixisheng.github.io)

##  ##

```
$ git clone git://host.xz[:port]/path/to/repo.git
```

[](https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clone), `git clone --help`
```
git clone [--template=<template_directory>]
      [-l] [-s] [--no-hardlinks] [-q] [-n] [--bare] [--mirror]
      [-o <name>] [-b <name>] [-u <upload-pack>] [--reference <repository>]
      [--dissociate] [--separate-git-dir <git dir>]
      [--depth <depth>] [--[no-]single-branch] [--no-tags]
      [--recurse-submodules] [--[no-]shallow-submodules]
      [--jobs <n>] [--] <repository> [<directory>]
```

## 
1. git add .
2. git commit
3. git pull origin $(current_branch)'
4. git push origin $(current_branch)' OR  

## 
1. 
2. git pull origin master( )
3. git push origin $(current_branch)' OR  
4. 

## 
* git checkout -b {branch} ()
* git checkout {branch} ()
* git checkout --track origin/{branch} ( git pull)

## Tag
* git tag #
* git tag v1.2.1 #v.1.2.1
* git tag -a v1.2.1 b477cbc #commit
* git show v1.2.1  # v.1.2.1 
* git push --tags # 
* git tag -d 2.5.1001 #
* git push origin :refs/tags/1.2.0 #


## coding  ##

>Coding.net Tips : [GIT access is disabled on coding.net domain, please use git.coding.net instead. See detail: https://coding.net/u/coding/pp/54510]
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

    git remote set-url origin git://host.xz[:port]/path/to/repo.git


## rebase  ##

rebase[](https://huixisheng.github.io/git-rebase/)

### 1 ###

    git pull --rebase origin master


### 2  ###

    git checkout dev
    git reabse master
    git checkout master
    git merge dev

- [Git: git rebase](http://www.html-js.com/article/Week-end-column-Git-crash-course-git-rebase)


## submodule  subtree ##

    git rm cached app/Library
    rm -rf app/Library
    vi .git/config  submodule 
    rm .gitmodules

    //subtree

    git remote add Library git://host.xz[:port]/path/to/repo.git
    git subtree add prefix=app/Library Library dev
    git checkout -b dev
    git pull origin dev   


##   ##

    git clone git://host.xz[:port]/path/to/repo.git
    composer update
    mkdir storage
    chmod -R 777 storage/
    mkdir -p bootstrap/cache/
    chmod -R 777 bootstrap/cache/
    php artisan route:cache
    php artisan config:cache

**ps: todo **

##  ##

- [coding.net Permission denied (publickey)](https://coding.net/u/rainy/pp/30783)
- [ ssh key](https://help.github.com/articles/generating-ssh-keys/)
- [git](http://huixisheng.github.io/git/)

Post.title: PHP  Code Sniffer
Post._content:
[PHP  Code Sniffer](https://blog.stephencode.com/p/php_code_sniffer.html) phpcs  phpcbf  phpmd ~

> PHPMD is a spin-off project of PHP Depend and aims to be a PHP equivalent of the well known Java tool PMD. PHPMD can be seen as an user friendly and easy to configure frontend for the raw metrics measured by PHP Depend.

![phpmd](https://cdn.stephencode.com/article/php/phpmd.png)

 IDE IDE 

 PHPStorm  Sublime Text ~

## 

 composer

```
composer global require "phpmd/phpmd"
```



```
sudo ln -s /Users/stephen/.composer/vendor/phpmd/phpmd/src/bin/phpmd /usr/bin/phpmd
```

## 

```
$ phpmd /path/to/ text unusedcode

/path/to/test.php:25    Avoid unused local variables such as '$a'.
/path/to/test.php:26    Avoid unused local variables such as '$b'.
```

 `text`  `xml`

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<pmd version="@project.version@" timestamp="2017-09-22T01:33:16+00:00">
  <file name="/path/to/test.php">
    <violation beginline="25" endline="25" rule="UnusedLocalVariable" ruleset="Unused Code Rules" externalInfoUrl="http://phpmd.org/rules/unusedcode.html#unusedlocalvariable" priority="3">
      Avoid unused local variables such as '$a'.
    </violation>
    <violation beginline="26" endline="26" rule="UnusedLocalVariable" ruleset="Unused Code Rules" externalInfoUrl="http://phpmd.org/rules/unusedcode.html#unusedlocalvariable" priority="3">
      Avoid unused local variables such as '$b'.
    </violation>
  </file>
</pmd>
```

 `text` 

 `unusedcode` `cleancode, codesize, controversial, design, naming, unusedcode`

[](https://phpmd.org/rules/index.html)

##  Sublime 

### 

 `Package Control` 

 `phpcs`  `Settings - User`  `Settings - Default`

### 



```json
{
    "phpmd_run": true,

    "phpmd_command_on_save": true,

    "phpmd_executable_path": "phpmd",

    "phpmd_additional_args": {
        "codesize,controversial,design,naming,unusedcode": ""
    },
}
```



1. `"codesize,controversial,design,naming,unusedcode"` 
2. `cleancode`  Laravel Laravel 

>  Sublime `Ctrl + ~` 

 `"codesize,controversial"`  `"codesize, controversial"`

```
[Phpcs] Cannot find specified rule-set " controversial".
```

---



- [Mess Detector ](https://phpmd.org)

Post.title: Travis CI
Post._content:
Travis CI  ~  ~

> Travis CI GitHub

![travis ci](https://cdn.stephencode.com/article/travis/travis.jpg)

 GitHub ~



 FTP  FTP  Git  Git 

  GitHub Linus  push  pull 

 push  pull  Travis CI 

 Travis  ~

 GitHub  Travis  Jenkis Travis  GitHub 

~

##  Travis

 GitHub ~

 GitHub  repo

![add repo](https://cdn.stephencode.com/article/travis/add-repo.jpg)

 build

 Travis Settings 



![build step](https://cdn.stephencode.com/article/travis/buil-step.png)

###  .travis.yml

 Travis 

 PHP  Laravel  PHP 

```YML
language: php

php:
  - 7.1.9
  - nightly
```

### 

 `.travis.yml`  GitHub Travis 



 `phpunit` 

```
PHP Warning:  require(/home/travis/build/stephencode/super-admin/bootstrap/../vendor/autoload.php): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in /home/travis/build/stephencode/super-admin/bootstrap/autoload.php on line 17
```

 composer  `autoload.php`  `composer up`  `install` 

```
install:
  - composer install --prefer-dist --optimize-autoloader --quiet
```



```
1) Tests\Feature\RouteTest::testBasicTest
RuntimeException: No application encryption key has been specified.
```

 Laravel  `phpunit.xml`  `<env name="APP_KEY" value="base64:xxxxxx="/>`  `<php></php>`  key 

 build failed 

![build failed](https://cdn.stephencode.com/article/travis/build-failed.png)

## 

Travis  `after_success` 

 Travis 

### 

Travis Docs [Encrypting Files](https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/encrypting-files/)



 Ruby  gem  travis

```
gem install travis
```

 shell 

```
$ gem sources -l

*** CURRENT SOURCES ***

https://rubygems.org/
```

rubygems[Ruby China](http://gems.ruby-china.org/) ~

```
$ gem update --system
$ gem sources --add https://gems.ruby-china.org/
```

 gem  Ruby China  gem 

 travis 

```
$ sudo gem install travis
```

 Travis

```
$ travis login

We need your GitHub login to identify you.
This information will not be sent to Travis CI, only to api.github.com.
The password will not be displayed.

Try running with --github-token or --auto if you don't want to enter your password anyway.

Username: xxx@xxx.xxx
Password for xxx@xxx.xxx: ***
Successfully logged in as demo!
```

 GitHub  GitHub 

 `.travis.yml`  travis  SSH  SSH  [SSH ](https://blog.stephencode.com/p/ssh_login_no_pwd.html)

```
$ travis encrypt-file ~/.ssh/id_rsa --add

Detected repository as xxx/xxx, is this correct? |yes| yes
encrypting ~/.ssh/id_rsa for xxx/xxx
storing result as id_rsa.enc
storing secure env variables for decryption

Make sure to add id_rsa.enc to the git repository.
Make sure not to add ~/.ssh/id_rsa to the git repository.
Commit all changes to your .travis.yml.
```

 `.travis.yml`

```
before_install:
  - openssl aes-256-cbc -K $encrypted_d89376f3278d_key -iv $encrypted_d89376f3278d_iv
  -in id_rsa.enc -out ~\/.ssh/id_rsa -d
```

 shell

```
before_install:
  - openssl aes-256-cbc -K $encrypted_d89376f3278d_key -iv $encrypted_d89376f3278d_iv
    -in id_rsa.enc -out ~/.ssh/id_rsa -d
  - chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_rsa
```

 travis  SSH  addons 

```
addons:
  ssh_known_hosts: your-ip
```

travis ~

## 

~

### 

 Shell  Demo 

```bash
#!/bin/bash
cd /path/to/your-project
git pull origin master
echo 'travis build done!'
```

### 

 `.travis.yml` 

```
after_success:
  - ssh your-user@your-ip "./your-shell-script"
```

 `your-user``your-ip``your-shell-script` 

## 

 GitHub  README.md  `build:passing` 

![build tag](https://cdn.stephencode.com/article/travis/build-tag.png)

## 

 shell 

 `.travis.yml`

```yml
language: php

php:
  - 7.1.9
  - nightly

env:
  - APP_DEBUG=false

before_install:
  - openssl aes-256-cbc -K $encrypted_d89376f3278d_key -iv $encrypted_d89376f3278d_iv
    -in id_rsa.enc -out ~/.ssh/id_rsa -d
  - chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_rsa

install:
  - composer install --prefer-dist --optimize-autoloader --quiet

notifications:
  email:
    recipients:
    - stephenfxl@gmail.com
    on_success: always
    on_failure: always

script:
  - phpunit -c phpunit.xml --coverage-text

after_success:
  - ssh xxx@xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx "./travis_build" # IP

addons:
  ssh_known_hosts: xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx # IP

```



- [Travis](https://www.liaoxuefeng.com/article/0014631488240837e3633d3d180476cb684ba7c10fda6f6000)
- [Jekyll + Travis CI ](https://mritd.me/2017/02/25/jekyll-blog-+-travis-ci-auto-deploy/)

```yml
language: php

php:
  - 7.1.9
  - nightly

env:
  - APP_DEBUG=false

before_install:
  - openssl aes-256-cbc -K $encrypted_d89376f3278d_key -iv $encrypted_d89376f3278d_iv
    -in id_rsa.enc -out ~/.ssh/id_rsa -d
  - chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_rsa

install:
  - composer install --prefer-dist --optimize-autoloader --quiet

notifications:
  email:
    recipients:
    - stephenfxl@gmail.com
    on_success: always
    on_failure: always

script:
  - phpunit -c phpunit.xml --coverage-text

after_success:
  - ssh xxx@xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx "./travis_build" # IP

addons:
  ssh_known_hosts: xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx # IP

```
